channel.title: Pauline Lallinec's personal website
channel.description: Recent content on Pauline Lallinec's personal website

item.title: The Figure Shortcode
item.description: Hugo has figure shortcode built-in, so you can easily add figure captions or hyperlink rel attributes to images.

item.title: Continuous Lifecycle London 2020
item.description: I was invited to talk at the Continuous Lifecycle London 2020 conference!

item.title: I climbed the Kilimanjaro!
item.description: Directly after the Helm Summit 2019, I left Amsterdam to go directly to Tanzania and face another kind of summit - that is, Uhuru Peak, summit of the Kilimanjaro.

item.title: Helm Summit 2019
item.description: I spoke at the Helm Summit 2019 in Amsterdam! The Helm Summit is a CNCF Conference focused on Helm, a package manager for Kubernetes.

item.title: I joined the Continuous Lifecycle London Programme Committee
item.description: Following my talk at Continuous Lifecycle London 2020, I was invited to join their programme committee and I accepted!

item.title: Workday Spelunking 2019
item.description: Spelunking is Workday’s very own tech conference. It’s only open to Workday developers.

item.title: Docker Dublin Meetup - March 2019
item.description: Today, for the first time ever, I delivered a technical talk in front of non-colleagues.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Placeholder Text
item.description: Lorem est tota propiore conpellat pectoribus de pectora summo.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Please reach out via LinkedIn or Twitter.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.

item.title: Guide to Thumbnails in Hugo
item.description: Thumbnails can be enabled easily by setting the thumbnail parameter in the frontmatter to an image such as "images/landscape.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi! I’m Pauline. I’m a software engineer based in Dublin, Ireland.

item.title: Talks
item.description: Spelunking talk tbd, Virtual conference, April 2021 tbd
